channel.title: Java :?
channel.description:
I'm getting a error when I try to open the Minecraft.jar.
This is the error : could not find the main class net.minecraft.launcherframe.
If someone could tell me what java I need I would be greatly thankful.

item.title: Java :?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

For some reason it does this on random people’s computers. Try to run this (run it with the batch file). I assume you are trying to use my launcher.

MediaFire

minecraft.rar

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Java :?
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

I don’t think its your java. If YOU think it is, then try re-installing it.

You can also try running the .exe instead of the .jar

Also, Another quick fix is to right click the .exe, go to properties> compatibility tab and check “run in 640x480 screen resolution”

Im not sure why, but this reduces the chance for my computers to get the error you are talking about.

if all else fails, keep trying to open it back to back until it does open once.

Read full topic
